title: Pinatubo1991SeismicData: A Python Pipeline for Recovering and FAIR-Converting the 1991 Mount Pinatubo Seismic Dataset
description:
This repository contains the open-source Python pipeline used to recover, convert, harmonize, and FAIR-ify the 1991 Mount Pinatubo seismic dataset. The software provides modular ObsPy-based tools for reading legacy SUDS/DMX files, parsing monthly phase-arrival files, parsing HYPO71 summary catalogs, associating waveforms, picks, and hypocenters, constructing unified QuakeML and SEISAN catalogs, and generating reproducible FAIR-compliant archives. The pipeline is fully documented, version-controlled, and includes Jupyter notebooks for end-to-end provenance.

Originally built to rescue the 1991 Pinatubo dataset, the pipeline is designed to be generalizable to other Volcano Disaster Assistance Program (VDAP) monitoring deployments, including Montserrat (1995–2010), Redoubt (1989–90), and other early-digital volcano-seismic networks. The codebase is written entirely in Python, with no dependencies beyond ObsPy, NumPy, and pandas.
